reviews.review_msg: Professor Scott MacEachern is the best prof in SFU. The course ran both synchronously and asynchronously. I did not do good on the first midterm, yet I still enjoyed learning accounting. He does not give tricky questions- the ones covered in class and homework are testable! If possible, take a course with him. You will not regret it.

Scott is the GOAT. Funniest guy you will ever meet. His videos are seriously entertaining. He turns a boring subject like accounting into something fun. Highly recommend taking a class with Scott if possible. Hes a really nice guy and our whole class loved him to death

Fall20. Best prof so far during remote. Makes the best video lectures. Pre-recorded videos are multiple short videos, so its easy to maintain focus. His tone captures your attention unlike other boring profs. I thought Ill get bored in this class cos its Accounting, but no, he has excellent teaching style, very modern. Exams are well written.

Scott is hands down the best prof I've ever had. Lots of weekly homework and readings for a 3 unit course but overall the homework-type questions are fairly similar to the midterms and final. Would 100% recommend taking any course with Scott!

Scott is a real one. Although the class is curved, he is a brilliant professor who dedicates a lot of time to his pre-recorded lectures to make them insightful with a sense of humour. Exams are appropriate and tutorials are helpful as well. He makes accounting concepts clear for a person whose teacher for accounting in high school wasn't great,

BEST prof at SFU. he really cares and puts in a lot of effort to his video lectures and live lectures. accessible through email when you have questions. I don't even really like accounting but taking it with Scott makes it fun. the course isn't that easy per se but there are lots of resources and if you keep up and do the work it should be fine.

this man puts in so much effort for all of his lectures and really cares about his students! I am taking 254 with him as well :) he really cares about his students and will help you achieve a high grade. I struggled with financial accounting and he really helped make it as easy as possible. love the guy

Scott is a great prof I would recommend him to anyone who is taking BUS 251. His lectures were pre recorded and were very informative and concise. Every concept in the chapter has a specific video 5-10 minutes long). He emails back fast and is super helpful. His class is fair but make sure you know the concepts for the exams and how to apply them.

Hilarious, accessible, and shows that he genuinely cares about his students! He puts a lot of effort into his online lectures and uses humor to keep students engaged. Although you would still need to work for a good mark, he explains the concepts much better than any other prof I've had in Beedie!

Scott is a great online professor. The workload was completely reasonable and helped you stay on track. He records lectures as well as having live sessions to go over the recorded material. Tutorials help understand the course but you also have some random tutorials where there is participation marks awarded so make sure you attend. Exams were fair

All you need to know is that Scott is amazing. Makes me want to be an accountant. He literally made a video game for us. He is so dedicated to teaching, take any course with him, you cant go wrong. His class brought me JOY during the pandemic. So grateful for Scott

One of my favourite profs so far! Loved his lecture videos because they explained the material well and were interesting to watch. Accounting is not my favourite subject but I would take this class again if I had him as my prof!

Scott is simply amazing. He made online school so much more bearable with his engaging and entertaining lecture videos. He created asynchronous videos to watch, and then in class, he goes over practice problems and makes everything extremely easy to understand. One of the best teachers I have ever had. Not to mention, he's quite handsome as well ;)

Scott is definitely one of the best professors out there! He makes videos for each lesson (posted online) which are both informative and funny, and he follows up with a live lecture where he goes into more detail about that weeks lesson/topic. His midterms/finals are fair, and as long as you read the textbook and watch his videos, you'll do fine!

This man may single handedly be one of the best teachers I have every had. His lectures are so engaging, he always makes jokes, and he is SO good at teaching. He makes the concepts so simple and easy to understand. Def need to be reading the textbook for this class. This is a very time consuming class and it is a tough class to get an A in.
Scott is a really good prof who puts a lot of effort into his online classes.

Scott is definitely one of if not the best professor I have had in university so far. Not only does he clearly know his stuff and is passionate about what he does, but he does a great job at explaining things in a way that makes it easy to understand. As long as you put in the work, expect a good mark and an enjoyable class overall.
Scott made this class so enjoyable and his lectures helped a lot. the assignments really helped for the tests. if you have the chance to take any course with him do it!!!!!

Scott is a great guy who simply knows what he's talking about. Puts some great effort into his online asynchronous lectures to make them a little more interesting. Really reasonable and his tests are very fair.

Scott was a great professor and I would love to take a class with him again. Good at teaching during lectures, and also very funny at times! Textbook wasn't necessary as everything you need to know you go over in class and with the assigned homework. His tests were really fair and he tells you exactly what's going to be on them.

Scott was a very good prof for this class! I have heard many bad things when it comes to the professors who teach this class and he exceeded expectations. His teaching was very clear and enthusiastic. He was always available for questions and always willing to help you do better. Really enjoyed this class because of him!!

One of the best professors I've had! His passion and enthusiasm make accounting seem so much more interesting, and his jokes lighten up the class. He also prepped us very well for the midterm. I would definitely recommend Scott as a prof!

Scott is one of the most passionate profs you could ever have! He cares for his students and tries to make accounting as interesting as possible. He's also super nice and willing to accommodate students' request, even pretty ridiculous ones. He's clear on what will be on exams! Makes his own slides instead of relying on txtbook!
Scott has been the best prof I have had at SFU. His lectures are engaging and he is very knowledgable and practical while teaching difficult concepts. Definitely would recommend.
Only tested on in class material, has slides literally describing what to study. If you have half a brain you should be able to do decent in Scott's class
Great Professor! He will only test you on things covered in class and gives great examples in lectures. If you do the homework practice questions you will ace the exam.

Great professor. Made this class easy to understand. Midterm was very easy however the final was tough. So far my favourite prof at SFU. He keeps lectures interesting and is always willing to help. Gives students chances to redeem themselves for hw and quizzes.

You can tell Angela tries her best to deliver good lectures but teaching remotely is not a friendly method. Attending her office hours is helpful, email? bruh. Besides, she requires specific answers to essay questions, so the average is always low. Worth taking compared to the other profs who teaches BUS251.

She wants very specific answers, so even if your answers are correct, you're not getting points if you use different wording. Does not provide exam or quiz answers and reviews after they're done. Does not clearly answer emails. Lectures are extremely boring but that is subjective. Unproductive learning experience.
She is a horrible instructor, doesn't help if you have any doubts. Going for her office hours is completely useless.
Angela is super nice!!!! Just choose her.

As opposed to her Bus 251 counterpart, Angela is a way better choice. Her lectures, although boring, are somewhat useful in a sense that you can use them to get ready for both exams. The finals worth 50%, so definitely pay more attention to the post-midterm material. Just dont skip any classes and DO ALL OF THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS and youll be ok.
Angela is a nice Accounting instructor! Do practicing !!!
Good prof and TERRIBLE course.
Easy course.
Attend the class. Listen to the lecture. Ask questions if you have. Angela is a reliable instructor as long as you want to do well in accounting. She lets you make effort for your grade.

Angela is a very experienced accountant. Relatively a much better choice for BUS251 (You know what I mean). She is nice, glad to answer questions and listen to students. Do not miss the class because the participation counts 10%. Make sure do the notes as well as finish the homework and you will be fine.

She is a new instructor at FIC... However you can not easily tell that because it seems that she is very experienced in teaching accounting, at least based on her accountant identity. Clear lecture and glad to help students. Although there are so many students who retake this course and it is kind of challenging, choosing her is better.
I love her.
She is really nice, glad to help students.

If you want everything spelled out to you.. she is not very clear. But I felt like I learned all the concepts very thoroughly with a lot of independent work. Tutorials were EXTREMELY helpful. Homework was EXTREMELY helpful. Don't fall behind in this class! The midterm and final were really not that hard if you had not fallen behind.
Midterm was hard, but she made the final a bit easier. Awesome prof. Extremely helpful and really knows what she is talking about. Definately recommend!
Amazing professor. Funny too. Extremely helpful. I liked the course so the exams were easy. Breezed through the class.
One of the best prof I ever had....Listen to the lecture take notes, read first 3 chapters and u good to go)
One of my best prof!!!Come, Listen. take notes, ask a question, and thats it))But make sure u read first 3 chapters....

The best professor I've had. She is clear, knows her stuff and does a lot of examples in class. She tells you what she expects on exams. Lecture is interesting and funny when she relates the material to her family. I hated accounting priot to attending this class, but now I am comfortable with it.

She focuses much on the theory part of the exam...I dunno if it's true she's not gonna curve the class..she wants to make up her grades scheme...I hope not. The exam is fair and doable though although it took me to the last mins.

Reading the textbook and doing the questions for homework really help, because she doesn't really cover everything. Also, she is one of the most unprofessional profs I have ever had. Her cell phone rings every tutorial, and she never stops talking about her family. Beyond that, her exams are alright but do contain some tricks.
Very attractive, smart, interesting, and funny prof! She definitely knows how to teach, the class isn't boring at all (even though accounting is a really boring subject).

Exams are hard but not impossible. Pretty straight forward but likes to focus on the theory aspect. She knows her stuff and is pretty funny at times. Lectures are a bit boring but that's because of the material.

Class is a little hard. My suggestion is to read the online study guide on wileyplus. Much more useful than the textbook. Midterm was hard and final was also hard but doable. She put way too much theory on the final than expected and not enough techinal stuff which is what financial accounting is all about. Course is ok. Nicole is very sexy! Enjoy!

class is hard, but shes avaliabe to help during office hour. need to do weekly assignemnts (but you have 3 chances). her quizzes are sometiems multiple choices  or true and false (with 3 chances). shes only teaching to take a break from KPMG. if she knows you well enough she can hook you up for your first bus coop or parttime tehre.
worst teacher ever, can't speak english stay away, needs to go back to school
Very long exam, extremely difficult to keep awake during lectures
Took for 321. Great prof, exams were very fair, not too challenging but also not too easy. No projects or papers which is nice, just very short weekly assignments and two exams.
Mr Mowbray seems to genuinely care for his students's wellbeing and encourages them to take on useful challenges which was evident in his courses. Recommended!

Grant was a great professor and made accounting much more easy than I thought. I took it in Summer of 2024 and it was a flipped class where you do all your readings and assignments outside of the class online and then come into class and ask questions. 

His exams were very fair and were very similar to his practice exams. Do those a ton!
Good luck with him

Would recommend taking 251 with Grant, he went over practice problems in class and provided good resources to help with midterm and final. He was also always willing to help after class or via email. Tests were fair and similar to the practice exams. Course content was heavy so make sure you put in time to study each week to do good.

Great guy, great prof. He took an inherently dry subject in accounting and was able to add some personality and humor to it. Not saying the lectures were fun, but they weren't super boring. He does a great job at explaining concepts, and takes lots of time for questions. He also provides lots of resources (practice tests, recorded lecs, etc)

Come to class and do your readings.  The professor is fair but the volume required by this course is enormous.  He tells you at the beginning if you don't have enough time to dedicate to this class, don't take it. This is completely accurate.  If you don't have 6-7 hours a week to dedicate to this class, drop it.
Just listen to the lecture and always practice the questions (no surprised questions in the exams), and you will get a very good grade. He is a nice guy and very cares about his students!
Funny guy. Felt like his rating was too low.
This rating is for BUS  252.

Grant does come across somewhat inexperienced as a lecturer and his explanations of topics is sometimes lacking. That said, he is approachable and willing to help. His tests are not easy so expect to put in a lot of preparation.
Amazing professor, was taking accounting for the first time in my life but he made it look soo easy
Amazing professor will always love to take a course with him

BUS251 is a challenging course, alone, but he keeps things light in lectures by using fun analogies. He assigns weekly homework in WileyPlus (you have unlimited attempts to solve problems) and his tutorials are optional to attend, but recommended as the material can be super complicated. His final was almost exactly the same as the practice final.

Clearly very passionate about accounting and willing to answer any questions (without making you feel dumb!) He is always on top of posting course materials and posts recorded lectures so you can effectively cram before exams.

Grant is an awesome professor. He is approachable, knowledgeable, and friendly. His lectures are tremendous because he keeps them engaging, and explains concepts well. Assignments and exams were well thought out and explained, so we knew what to expect. I would highly recommend Grant as your next professor.

Grant is a great prof, and is always available if help is needed. It's the course overall that is challenging as so much is covered and tested. Out of all the accounting profs, I'd take another accounting course with him. Tips for exams: go through practice/homework questions over and over again, and memorize ratios and other formulas. Goodluck.
Very clear and to the point with class material always there to try to help students as well

Everyone gives this prof such great reviews, but I am currently struggling in his class. I barely passed the first exam, and everyone said exams would be exactly like the homework, but its not. Its much harder.
The scale for quality is too high for him. Even -100 would be a stretch. Take with a different professor. Avoid him. Should be suspended immediately.
Not very good professor.  Boring lectures.  Dont give online notes, and goes thru slide so fast that it's impossible to copy anything down.  super hard exams

Good TA's (I recommend Hector). His exams were REALLY HARD!!!!! Avg. mark was 51/100!!!!!!!!! But if anything he does joke around in class and is a nice guy- but expects you to be an expert in accounting so you better get caught up on your balance sheets because his exams are mighty hard!!!
